## Introduction

The Java Advanced Java EE Features documentation provides an overview of advanced features and functionalities available in Java EE. This document aims to help developers understand and utilize these features effectively.

## Objective and Scope

The objective of this documentation is to provide developers with a comprehensive understanding of advanced Java EE features. It covers topics such as Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB), Java Persistence API (JPA), Java Message Service (JMS), JavaServer Faces (JSF), and more.

The scope of this documentation includes step-by-step instructions, code snippets, troubleshooting tips, best practices, and recommendations to ensure developers can leverage these advanced features successfully.

## Requirements and Pre-requisites

To follow along with this documentation, you will need the following:

- Java Development Kit (JDK) installed
- Java EE application server (such as Apache Tomcat or GlassFish)
- Integrated Development Environment (IDE) like Eclipse or IntelliJ IDEA

## Step-by-Step Instructions

This section provides detailed, easy-to-follow instructions for utilizing various advanced Java EE features. Each topic will have a separate set of instructions, covering the necessary configuration and usage steps.

- [Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB)](./ejb.md)
- [Java Persistence API (JPA)](./jpa.md)
- [Java Message Service (JMS)](./jms.md)
- [JavaServer Faces (JSF)](./jsf.md)
- [Java Servlets](./servlets.md)
- [Java API for RESTful Web Services (JAX-RS)](./jax-rs.md)
- [Java Authentication and Authorization Service (JAAS)](./jaas.md)

## Code Snippets and Commands

Throughout this documentation, relevant code snippets and terminal commands will be provided to illustrate the usage of advanced Java EE features. These snippets will help developers understand the syntax and implementation details.

## Troubleshooting and Common Issues

In this section, you will find solutions to common problems that developers may encounter while working with advanced Java EE features. Troubleshooting tips and techniques will be provided to help resolve issues efficiently.

## Best Practices and Recommendations

To ensure optimal performance and security, this section will provide best practices and recommendations for utilizing advanced Java EE features. Following these guidelines will help developers write efficient and maintainable code.

## Summary and Conclusion

In the summary and conclusion section, a recap of the key points covered in this documentation will be provided. Additionally, final thoughts and recommendations will be shared to help developers further explore and utilize advanced Java EE features.

By following this documentation, developers will gain a solid understanding of advanced Java EE features and be able to leverage them effectively in their applications.
